TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP citizen , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE ( GPE ) .
The applicant , a NORP national , was the NORP Ambassador to GPE from DATE .
In DATE ORG of GPE initiated legal proceedings against the applicant as a consequence of which he was suspended from office by a ministerial order .
On DATE ORG of GPE annulled the ministerial order suspending the applicant from office . On an unspecified date the applicant withdrew from politics .
In DATE the applicant and his family applied to the President of GPE for NORP citizenship . On DATE the President of the Republic granted them NORP citizenship .

On DATE the newly elected President of the Republic ex officio declared null and void the president 's decree of DATE , thereby revoking the applicant 's NORP citizenship as having been obtained through forged documents . According to the decree the applicant had filed forged documents indicating that no criminal proceedings were pending against him in GPE .
On DATE at TIME several police officers , some of them armed , took the applicant and his wife to a police station in GPE for official notification of the decree .
After TIME of waiting , a copy of the president 's decree of DATE was served on the applicant , revoking his NORP citizenship .
Moreover , the Deputy Chief of ORG verbally ordered the applicant to leave NORP territory by DATE ( that is to say , within DATE ) pursuant to a deportation order dated DATE or face forcible exile .
On DATE ORG issued a press release to the effect that the applicant had been ordered to leave the territory by DATE as his NORP citizenship , obtained through forged documents , had been revoked .
On DATE the police , without apparent reason , prohibited the applicant and his family from leaving the apartment . The situation was resolved by the intervention of a Member of ORG .
On DATE the applicant received a letter from ORG reminding him to leave NORP territory by DATE .

On DATE the applicant lodged an action with ORG claiming that the president 's decree of DATE should be annulled as unconstitutional . Moreover , he requested , by way of an interim measure , that execution of the deportation order be stayed .
On DATE the ORG declined jurisdiction to deal with the applicant 's claim and indicated ORG as the competent authority .
On DATE , following the applicant 's complaint , ORG decided to dismiss his appeal as being outside its jurisdiction .
On DATE ORG ) quashed ORG decision of DATE and sent the case for a retrial before ORG as the authority competent to deal with the applicant 's complaint .
On DATE , after DATE of inactivity , ORG , in retrial proceedings , decided to annul the president 's decree of DATE as unsubstantiated , thereby confirming the applicant 's NORP citizenship .
On DATE the applicant lodged an action with ORG claiming that the deportation order of DATE and the police order of CARDINAL DATE were null and void .

According to the applicant 's submissions , the first - instance court proceedings had lasted DATE and DATE , and CARDINAL hearings had been fixed . The court 's hearings had been adjourned on several occasions as a result of the unjustified absence of ORG legal advisers . The latter had been absent from CARDINAL consecutive court hearings without giving any reasons .
On DATE ORG suspended its examination of the applicant 's complaint since the courts had decided on the validity of the president 's decree .

On DATE the court resumed the proceedings . In DATE it fixed CARDINAL hearings and , in the absence of the authorities ' representatives , continued the proceedings in the applicant 's presence alone .
On DATE , in the absence of the authorities ' representatives , ORG declared null and void the deportation order and the police order of DATE as incompatible with the legal criteria .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW provides that the President of the Republic has the power to grant and revoke NORP citizenship in accordance with the law .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of PERSON no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE on the acquisition and revocation of NORP citizenship reads as follows :
Section CARDINAL
Acquisition of citizenship by naturalization
“ A foreigner who has submitted an application for acquisition of NORP citizenship by naturalization shall acquire it if he fulfils the following requirements :

He has reached DATE ; he has lawfully resided in the territory of GPE for not less than DATE ; he has a dwelling and sufficient income ; he has never been sentenced in his state or in GPE or in any third state for a criminal offence for which the law provides for a prison sentence of not DATE . Exemption from this rule is made only if it is proved that the sentence was given for political reasons ; he has at least elementary knowledge of the NORP language ; and his acceptance as an NORP citizen does not affect the security and defence of GPE ... ”
Section CARDINAL
Revocation of decision granting citizenship

“ The decision granting NORP citizenship may be revoked if it is proved that the alien or stateless person has intentionally supported his application for acquisition of NORP citizenship with incorrect data or falsified documents ... ”
